item.title: Daily Briefing - 2026-02-12
item.description:
**Morning Briefing**
**What Changed Since Yesterday** Global equity markets showed slight gains overnight. Oil prices remain stable but are under close watch. The U.S. dollar has strengthened against major currencies. No significant economic indicators released today.
**Venezuela Update** Venezuela's political landscape remains tense. Recent talks between government and opposition leaders have stalled. Humanitarian conditions worsen as economic sanctions continue to affect the populace.
**UK Response Signals** The UK government reiterated its stance on supporting Ukraine. Increased military aid is expected to be announced this week. There are ongoing discussions regarding energy policy amid rising costs.
**Legal/Docket Watch (Epstein-related)** None.
**What to Watch Today** Watch for any developments on global inflation rates in upcoming reports. Monitor any market reactions to the new military aid announcement from the UK. Observe any significant shifts in oil prices due to geopolitical tensions.
End of briefing.
